I recently had a flight cancellation due to fog where all airlines were cancelling most flights. I waited in the airport for 5.5hrs before being told the flight was cancelled. Not sure why an Aer Lingus flight to the same destination as ours managed to depart, scheduled 1.5hrs after ours? You may think why the 4stars? I managed to get through quickly to AL rebooked a flight for the next day. They said to book a hotel, meals & transport would be covered too. (Nb; 2 different AL personnel advised us that there were no limits on expense claims for hotel/meals/transport, this was incorrect. It is £250 max) I submitted my receipts a few days after getting home. AL confirmed the receipts and stated I would get £240 back. This was in my account within 7 working days! Hence the 4-stars. This type of quick resolution rarely happens with big companies so well done AL!

Review Text: I love travelling with Aer Lingus, no problem with their customer service, lovely people BUT I am trying to book return tickets to Dublin for this July. I can book outward flight from London but each time I try to book the two flights back their website keeps showing tickets are gone so I will be driving over on Stenna ferries

Refund not issued in agreed time.

Complaint has been ignored.

Rude staff with poor grasp of English that do not know what they are doing. All giving different timescales for same issue.

Absolutely appalling - On the 21st December when I logged on to check my son travelling from Salt Lake home, I discovered that his booking had been cancelled. I rang customer service immediately and they said that it had been cancelled, it turns out that a third party who could not possibly have passed the initial security questions was somehow able to ring them and cancel my son's flight. I cannot understand how this could have possibly happened. Customer service were extremely unhelpful and told me that I would have to file a complaint and purchase another ticket for him. As it was Christmas and I felt I had no other option, I booked him on the exact same flights home and had to pay an extra £400 for the privilege and the flights were already extremely expensive given the time of year. On the evening of the 21st I received an email saying they would refund me the flight price and I wrote back to say great, I would also like to received the additional £400 I had to spend. I have heard absolutely nothing from them since. I have rung, whatsapp messaged and telephoned, in total 11 times and I am consistently told that my case has been referred to "the relevant department", and it seems I am not allowed to speak with them or contact "the relevant department" in any way. I am absolutely appalled with the situation. I literally spend thousands a year with the airline. In future I will give my money to a better company.
